title: datalad subdatasets output should not just suppress output (or provide info on how to expand)
body:
```
~/proj/nuisance$ datalad subdatasets -r
subdataset(ok): /home/chrispycheng/proj/nuisance/code/simple_workflow (dataset)
subdataset(ok): /home/chrispycheng/proj/nuisance/data/QA (dataset)
subdataset(ok): /home/chrispycheng/proj/nuisance/data/QA-mriqc (dataset)
subdataset(ok): /home/chrispycheng/proj/nuisance/data/dbic (dataset)
subdataset(ok): /home/chrispycheng/proj/nuisance/data/dbic/bids (dataset)
subdataset(ok): /home/chrispycheng/proj/nuisance/data/dbic/mriqc (dataset)
subdataset(ok): /home/chrispycheng/proj/nuisance/data/dbic/simple_workflow (dataset)
subdataset(ok): /home/chrispycheng/proj/nuisance/data/dbic/sourcedata/dbic-BIDS (dataset)
subdataset(ok): /home/chrispycheng/proj/nuisance/data/dbic/sourcedata/dbic-BIDS/Chang (dataset)
subdataset(ok): /home/chrispycheng/proj/nuisance/data/dbic/sourcedata/dbic-BIDS/Chang/Chang (dataset)
  [53 similar messages have been suppressed]
action summary:
  subdataset (ok: 63)
```
the whole point of running the command is to see subatasets, so not sure if just suppressing without giving a hint on how to avoid that is a good UX
